comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content:
This is not Lt. Hermann Gilly. It is Fritz Beckhardt, a German/Jewish fighterr pilot. Interesting that he chose this marking. It did not mean what it later came to mean. It was, at the time, considered a good luck symbol.

Hermann Gilly flew with Jasta 40 and flew a black Fokker D.VII.

comment.author: 94003007@N03
comment._content: and the aircraft is a Siemens Schukert SS D.III
